intro: Araiostegia faberiana, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae, native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. It produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
